title: Pro-EU centrist Nicusor Dan wins tense Romania presidential vote rerun ahead of nationalist George Simion
summary: Dan gained more than 54% of the vote, while Trump admirer Simion secured close to 46%, according to nearly complete results.

title: Israel announces start of 'extensive ground operations' in Gaza
summary: After Israel said it was open to talks on 'ending the fighting' with Hamas earlier on Sunday, attacks were launched 'throughout the northern and southern Gaza Strip,' with dozens reported killed by rescue workers.

title: Anti-immigration minister Retailleau becomes leader of French conservatives
summary: Retailleau won 74% of the vote from party members against 25% for Laurent Wauquiez, the head of the party in the French national assembly.

title: Joe Biden diagnosed with 'aggressive,' advanced-stage prostate cancer
summary: The former Democratic president, 82, was 'diagnosed with prostate cancer' with 'metastasis to the bone,' his office said on Sunday. President Trump, later via social media, extended his and Melania's 'warmest and best wishes,' adding they 'wish Joe a fast and successful recovery.'

title: Ukraine's Zelensky meets with US VP Vance in Rome
summary: Meeting for the first time since their heated White House confrontation, the two men spoke in Rome after both attended the new Pope's inaugural mass.

title: 'Sinners': The blues-sucking vampire
summary: Ryan Coogler's grand spectacle film serves as a unique reflection on cultural appropriation.

title: Portugal votes in pivotal snap election as center-right eyes power without majority
summary: Portuguese voters head to the polls Sunday for the country's third general election in three years, with the center-right Democratic Alliance tipped to win the most seats,  but likely fall short of a parliamentary majority.

title: Polish presidential election: Von der Leyen gives Tusk a helping hand
summary: The president of the European Commission, who stands to benefit if the Polish prime minister strengthens his position, has shown particular leniency toward Poland on several key issues, such as immigration and the European Green Deal.

title: In the West Bank, the archaeological site of Sebastia under Israeli control
summary: The takeover of the ancient site illustrates the expansion of settlers and the Israeli army presence in this Palestinian territory, where activity has slowed since the beginning of the war in the Gaza Strip.

title: Mexican tall ship crashes into Brooklyn Bridge, killing two
summary: The Mexican Navy ship Cuauhtemoc, which serves as a training vessel, lost power as it was leaving New York and crashed into the bridge, snapping all three of its masts and leading to two deaths and 19 injuries on board.

title: In Lithuania, the fear of war with Russia lurks just around the corner
summary: Close to Russian troops from the Kaliningrad enclave, the residents of Kybartai are reliving the era of Soviet occupation, when this small Lithuanian town was a hotspot of dissidence.

title: The 'Berlin Wall of Asia' between India and Pakistan is a strange site of theater and tears
summary: The only land crossing point between the two countries has been closed since May 1, following an attack in Kashmir that led to the most severe military confrontation between New Delhi and Islamabad in decades.

title: More red meat and large cars: Why men emit more CO₂ than women in France
summary: According to a study published by the London School of Economics, French men's CO₂ emissions are, on average, 26% higher than women's in the food and transport sectors, the two largest sources of pollution in France.

title: Pope Leo XIV speaks against exploiting nature and the poor at his inaugural mass
summary: Worshippers and world leaders gathered at the Vatican on Sunday for the inaugural mass of Pope Leo XIV, the first American pontiff, who will later hold his first private audience with Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Rapper Werenoi, France's top-selling music artist in 2023-2024, has died at 31
summary: 'Rest in peace my brother, I love you,' read the tribute to French rapper Werenoi, born Jérémy Bana Owona, posted by his producer Babs, on X, confirming reports that the 31-year-old artist died on Saturday.

title: Tatiana Trouvé's poetic workshop
summary: The French-Italian artist, currently featured in a major exhibition at Palazzo Grassi in Venice, works in a former parquet factory in Montreuil, a suburb of Paris.

title: In search of flamboyant French film producer Pierre Edelman
summary: In the 1990s, producer Pierre Edelman knew everyone. His connections even allowed him to play a role in the making of some of the greatest films by David Lynch and Pedro Almodóvar. But the dandy in a white suit had a shadowy side, so much so that almost no one noticed when he disappeared.

title: Vehicle explosion at fertility clinic in California city was 'act of terrorism,' police say
summary: The FBI and other federal agencies are investigating the blast in Palm Springs, which has killed one person and damaged buildings in the vicinity.

title: Kim Kardashian Paris robbery trial: A grueling week of interrogations for defendants
summary: Most of the US star's 10 alleged robbers and their accomplices have continued to deny their involvement, though they have failed to convince the court.

title: 'Website publishers face the specter of a web created by and for AI'
summary: The widespread development of AI is causing a real revolution in the way search engines, particularly Google, are used, observes Le Monde's Alexandre Piquard in his column.

title: Ruling party tops Portugal polls marked by far-right surge
summary: Prime Minister Luis Montenegro's center-right Democratic Alliance won the most seats in the country's third general election in three years on Sunday, May 18, but again fell short of a parliamentary majority.

title: Shein, China's fast fashion behemoth, hampered by tariffs
summary: The online retail giant, operating in 150 countries, hoped for a significant debut on the London Stock Exchange this year. However, new tariffs imposed by the Trump administration and resistance in Europe against ultra-fast fashion, are threatening its global expansion.

title: Joe Biden reveals he has prostate cancer amid renewed debate over his health when he was president
summary: The former US president was diagnosed with an 'aggressive' but treatable form of the disease, according to his office. The news comes as the book 'Original Sin' revisits the blindness of his entourage when he decided to run for a second term, in 2023.

title: In Poland, two frontrunners for one presidential seat
summary: The liberal candidate and his ultraconservative rival are neck and neck after the first round of the election, casting doubt on the outcome of the second round, set for June 1. The far right achieved a historic score, thanks in particular to the youth vote.

title: 2025 Cannes Film Festival: 'The Phoenician Scheme,' Wes Anderson's intricate film full of humanity
summary: Master of whimsical adventure and vintage design, the American director returns to compete at the Croisette with the story of a wealthy man defying death.

title: From car horns to insults and sexual assault: Female joggers deal with constant harassment
summary: Fed up and sometimes traumatized by the sexist and sexual violence that disrupts their exercise sessions, female runners are forced to come up with strategies to reclaim public space while trying to ensure their safety.

title: Five years after Brexit, UK and EU aim for a fresh start
summary: An agreement between London and Brussels was confirmed on Monday morning, just ahead of the first UK–EU bilateral summit since Brexit. After years of tense relations, the meeting is meant to mark the start of a new alliance between Keir Starmer's Britain and the European Union.

title: Netanyahu says Israel will 'take control of all' of the Gaza Strip
summary: The Israeli army on Monday told Gazans in the southern city of Khan Yunis and nearby areas to 'evacuate immediately' ahead of an attack.

title: Romania's presidential election: The relief of pro-Europeans after Dan's victory over pro-Russian far right candidate
summary: The centrist mayor of Bucharest was elected president on Sunday, with 54% of the votes, against nationalist candidate George Simion, who led the first round on May 4 by a wide margin.

title: Trump to hold seperate phone calls with Putin and Zelensky
summary: President Donald Trump is hoping that separate calls on Monday with the Russian and Ukrainian leaders will make progress toward a ceasefire in the war in Ukraine.

title: Behind the billions in investment at Choose France, France's economic appeal faces headwinds
summary: Nearly €20 billion in new foreign investments are set to be announced on Monday in Versailles. This allows Emmanuel Macron to tout his economic record. However, the underlying reality is more complex.

title: Portugal's center right wins elections as the left collapses to the far right
summary: The extremist Chega party obtained as many MPs as the Socialist Party, but is expected to surpass it once the overseas votes are counted. The conservative Luis Montenegro is expected to remain prime minister.

title: UK and EU agree to trade deal to ease border frictions
summary: The deal removes most food and plant checks and links emissions quotas to avoid EU carbon taxes. Monday's discussions also included defense and fishing accords, marking a reset five years after Brexit.
